Global Impact
Making an impact by creating solutions that drive progress and transform industries has long been a part of the KLA DNA, and we remain committed to our purpose in everything we do – through leadership, opportunity, innovation and stewardship.
Environmental, Health & Safety Policy
KLA is dedicated to complying with the appropriate and relevant environmental, health & safety laws and standards such that its worldwide operations, including product development, sales, service and maintenance, are conducted in an environmentally responsible manner.

Global Impact
KLA’s ESG strategy is built around four strategic pillars: opportunity, innovation, environmental stewardship and leadership. Within these pillars, specific focus areas and objectives help us prioritize ESG investments and drive progress across our value chain, from our people and operations to our products, services and partnerships.
Our near-term, science-based Scope 1, 2 and 3 targets have been approved by the SBTi.

- Reduce Scope 3 GHG emissions from the use of sold products 52% per billion transistors inspected, measured or processed within the same timeframe

Our Commitment to Sustainability
We believe the future of the semiconductor industry is one in which innovation and sustainability are inextricably intertwined. This will require work on a scale that ranges from microscopic to global – a combination of deep science, technical problem-solving and collaboration across the value chain. As a company that has built its business on tackling complex challenges, we are committed to keep looking for – and leading with – solutions that will take us forward.
Our approach to sustainability is grounded in the belief that a relentless drive to innovate and improve can have a profound impact on our business, customers and the industry. KLA enables evolution and innovation in the data era across key industries, including automotive, mobile and data center by providing customers with comprehensive process control and process-enabling solutions for semiconductor manufacturing.
In 2024, KLA received approval from the Science Based Target initiative (SBTi) for our near-term, science-based targets covering Scope 1, 2 and 3.
In addition to our SBTi validated targets, KLA continues to demonstrate meaningful progress to achieving 100% renewable electricity by 2030 across our global operations and aims to achieve net-zero Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2050.
Global Impact Report
At KLA, sustainability is embedded in everything we do. Since 1976, we’ve helped customers increase yield and reduce waste through advanced process control in semiconductor manufacturing.
We believe innovation and impact go hand in hand. Our 2024 Global Impact Report outlines the progress we’ve made — not only in advancing semiconductor technology, but also in progressing on our commitment to sustainability and global responsibility.

Inclusion is foundational to KLA, both as a strategic imperative and an expression of our core values. Our inclusive culture expands the spectrum of innovation and problem-solving potential, fosters better decision making and supports business success.
It all connects when we do
All electronics are made up of connections. Different parts, different abilities, working together to create something bigger than themselves. That’s how KLA works too. Because to make products that push boundaries, we must first push our own. Learn from, and build on, each other’s wisdom and experiences.
All 15,000 of us, across over a dozen regions, bring something essential to KLA. Ourselves.
Inclusion for All is an Opportunity
At KLA, we don’t view inclusion as a problem that needs to be solved, but as an opportunity to embrace. Our mission is to learn from and build on each other’s wisdom, ideas, backgrounds and experiences. Our efforts focus on three primary drivers:
Build an inclusive environment. We bring out the best in ourselves and each other.
Increase engagement. We expand the spectrum of innovation and problem-solving potential.
Embody inclusive leadership. We lead by example to foster better decision making and productivity.
Employee Resource Groups
KLA’s Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) align with company goals and are open for all employee participation. Led by volunteers, these groups collaborate, share ideas and advance inclusion across the workplace.
BELIEVE
Black Employees Leading Inclusion, Excellence, Vision and Education (BELIEVE) progresses KLA’s inclusive environment through cultural awareness and understanding of the Black community.
BRIDGE
Building Relationships In Diverse Generations and Experiences (BRIDGE) conducts programs and events geared to create greater understanding, collaboration and belonging across multigenerational teams.
Konexión
Konexión fosters an inclusive community where employees interact and innovate together through sharing and understanding the multicultural Latinx community.
PRISM
PRISM (where Pride, Respect, Inclusion and Solidarity Meet) progresses KLA’s inclusive environment through cultural awareness, understanding, and safety of our LGBTQ+ employees.
VALOR
Veterans and Allies Leading for Organizational Results (VALOR) embraces the unique skills, capabilities and experiences of U.S. military veterans to foster high-performing teams.
Wise
Women in STEM Empowered (WISE) supports engagement of women in STEM fields by fostering an inclusive community.

How KLA enables 5G
5G delivers much more than a faster browsing experience to your mobile device. 5G networking technology is critical to enabling how independent systems interact synergistically with each other. Coupled with innovations in artificial intelligence (AI), 5G is changing how our world works, how we communicate, and how information flows in business and our personal lives. For example, automobile vehicle to everything (V2X) communication technology utilizes 5G to improve safety and help with traffic management by constantly monitoring and communicating with the surroundings. In addition, KLA’s technologies enable the manufacture of thinner and lighter advanced displays that are an essential part of many 5G devices.
KLA’s products are used at every stage in the 5G component manufacturing process, from R&D through high-volume production of ICs, packages and PCBs, to ensure the highest quality and reliability standards are achieved.
Integrated Circuit Quality
Semiconductor IC quality is fundamental to the success of mission-critical, low‐latency 5G services such as autonomous driving and security monitoring. High chip reliability and performance are achieved through implementation of comprehensive process control strategies across the semiconductor ecosystem.
Semiconductor Manufacturing
5G applications are driving increased adoption of electronic devices that utilize RF power amplifiers and high-frequency filters, sensors and MEMS devices. Robust IC process technologies and process control strategies improve chip performance and reliability.
Packaging Advances
New IC packaging architectures with complex levels of integration—system in package (SiP) and fan-out on both wafer and panel—enable the development of 5G devices. Process technologies, including etch, PVD, CVD, and UV laser drilling support the formation of these complex packaging schemes. During packaging processing and after component formation, tighter quality requirements drive the need for accurate inspections at the wafer, die and sub-package levels.
High Density Interconnect PCB
5G-enabled devices require advanced printed circuit boards with finer linewidths, straight sidewall geometry and multiple layers with more stringent quality and reliability requirements. PCB inspection, repair and imaging systems help manufacturers find and repair defective layers and trace the source of defects, increasing the yield and reliability of finished PCBs.

We sat down with John Robinson, Ph.D., senior principal scientist at KLA and SPIE fellow, to share some insights on AI from the 2025 SPIE Advanced Lithography + Patterning Symposium.
I wore several hats at the SPIE Advanced Lithography and Patterning symposium. I’m happy to report that we’re back to pre-COVID numbers in terms of paper submissions (more than 526) and attendees (over 2,200). We had four plenary talks by top industry speakers and 15 short courses from leading experts. I’m also in my 16th year as a program committee member for the Metrology, Inspection and Process Control conference.
The metrology conference continues to draw the largest number of submitted papers (more than 150) from among the six conferences, and it also generates large crowds. Additionally, I was attending as a member of the technical community, taking the opportunity to learn about the latest advancements, to network with industry experts, and to visit with long-term friends based on many years of participation.
Top talent is key to the continued success of advanced lithography and patterning. As such we are dedicating significant effort into attracting and retaining top students. Through initiatives such as the student grant program (which KLA is a sponsor) and student paper awards, we encourage student participation. The Karel Urbánek Best Student Paper Award, sponsored by KLA, is awarded annually by the Metrology, Inspection and Process Control program committee. A record 17 candidate student papers met the eligibility criterion. There were many excellent student presentations. Tim Houben of the Technische University of Eindhoven, for his paper “Optimizing surface reconstruction using a segmented scanning electron microscope detector and deep learning,” had the winning entry. He showed an in-depth understanding of both the SEM technology and of machine learning.
Each year, SPIE promotes select members to become fellows of the society. They are honored for both technical achievement as well as service to the technical community and SPIE in particular. The fellow program is celebrating its 70th year in 2025. The Advanced Lithography and Patterning symposium was honored to have four of this year’s awardees on hand for recognition.

我们的环境、社会和治理(ESG)旅程

我们不断增进对于与KLA最相关并不断演变的ESG话题的了解，相应管理这些话题，推动我们的表现改善。 2022年8月，KLA宣布了一个新目标，即到2030年将范围1和2的排放量降到2021年基线的50%，到2050年实现范围1和2的排放量达到净零。范围1和2的减排目标是基于科学目标倡议（SBTi）企业净零标准设定的。
2021年取得的进展：
- 宣布我们的目标——到2030年，我们将在全球业务中100%使用可再生电力。
- 制定了新的、改进的温室气体清单基线。
- 完成了对我们的范围1和2、范围3商务旅行温室气体清单、可再生能源进展的有限第三方核实。
- 根据气候相关财务信息披露工作组(TCFD)的建议，首次开展了深入的气候风险和机遇评估。
我们着力进一步降低对气候产生的影响，还将在2023年底之前评估和宣布在制定范围3减排目标方面取得的进展。

ESG를 향한 여정
적극적인 ESG(Environmental, social and governance) 임팩트 관리는 인류의 발전을 견인한다는 당사 사명의 핵심입니다. 이러한 사명을 달성하는 과정에서 당사의 ESG 전략은 결정을 알리고, 비즈니스와 지역사회에서 발전에 대한 책임을 지고, 고객 각자의 ESG 목표 달성을 지원하는 등 로드맵이 됩니다.
당사는 KLA와 가장 관련성이 높으며 진화를 거듭하는 ESG 주제에 대한 이해도를 지속적으로 향상하고, 이를 시의적절하게 관리하며, 성과를 개선하기 위한 여정에 있습니다. 지난 2022년 8월, KLA는 2030년까지 직접배출원(Scope 1) 및 간접배출원(Scope 2)의 탄소 배출량을 2021년 기준치 대비 50%로 감축하고, 2050년까지 직접 및 간접배출원에서 탄소중립(Net zero)을 달성하겠다는 새로운 목표를 발표했습니다. 직접 및 간접배출 감축 목표는 과학 기반 감축목표 이니셔티브(SBTi) 기업 탄소중립 표준에 따라 결정됩니다.
2021년에 달성한 성과:
- 2030년까지 전 세계 사업장에서 100% 재생 가능한 전기를 사용하겠다는 목표 발표
- 개선된 신규 온실가스(GHG) 인벤토리 기준 개발
- 직접배출, 간접배출, 기타 간접배출(Scope 3) 출장에 대한 당사 GHG 인벤토리의 제한적 제3자 검증 완료
- 기후관련 재무정보공개 협의체(TCFD)의 권고에 따라 제1회 기후 위험 및 기회 심층 평가 실시
당사는 기후에 미치는 영향을 더욱 줄이기 위해, 2023년 말까지 기타 간접배출 감축 목표 개발에 대한 진행 상황을 평가 및 발표할 예정입니다.
글로벌 임팩트 보고서
KLA는 오랜 시간 동안 인류 발전에 기여할 수 있는 영향력을 발휘할 수 있기를 꿈꾸었으며, 리더십, 기회, 혁신, 스튜어드십을 통해 모든 활동에서 당사의 목적에 전념하고 있습니다.
KLA Foundation
KLA Foundation은 인류의 발전을 위해 지역사회에 투자하여 더욱 공평하고 포용력 있으며 접근성이 높은 세상을 만들고자 힘쓰고 있습니다. 영향력을 발휘하기 위해서는 경청, 지속적인 협력, 인내, 인간의 필요에 대한 총체적인 이해가 필요하다고 믿습니다. KLA Foundation은 지역사회에 정통한 조직과의 전략적인 협력을 통해 지속 가능한 변화를 위한 업스트림 솔루션을 만들고, 직원들이 스스로 지지하는 대의에 참여하도록 지원합니다.

CDP 보고서
CDP는 글로벌 공개 시스템을 운영하여 투자자, 기업, 도시, 주, 지역이 환경에 미치는 영향을 관리할 수 있도록 지원하는 비영리 자선 단체입니다. 당사의 연례 CDP 보고서를 통해 KLA가 기후 변화 및 물 안보와 관련된 위험과 기회를 측정 및 관리하는 방법을 확인하실 수 있습니다. -
KLA의 글로벌 인권 표준
KLA는 모든 사람의 인권과 존엄성을 수호하기 위해 힘쓰고 있습니다. 윤리적인 근로와 법적 의무 준수는 KLA가 비즈니스를 수행하는 방식의 핵심입니다.

광고 쿠키
